By the time Obama took office in 2009, we sensed something profound was shifting, but we can only see exactly what shifted in the aftermath. The four pillars were put into place, and a new #FourthBranch of Government was quietly created." (...)

"The Intelligence Branch functions much like the (Deep-)State Dept, through a unique set of public-private partnerships that support it. #BigTech industry collaboration with intelligence operatives is part of that functioning, almost like an NGO. However, the process is much more important than most think. In this problematic perspective of a corrupt system of government, the process is the flaw – not the outcome. There are people making decisions inside this little known, unregulated and out-of-control branch of government that impact every facet of our lives. None of these people operating deep inside the Intelligence Branch were elected ..." (...)

"With the creation of the ODNI the 'terror threat' analysis now looked ‘internally‘. This is so very critical an inflection point it must be emphasized.
Prior to the ODNI the intelligence products from the CiA, NSA, DoD, DoS, DIA, were used to protect us (American citizens) from them (foreign actors). After the ODNI was created those same intelligence products were used to look inward, into U.S. citizens & as an outcome the tools were used to conduct domestic surveillance of threats to government from ‘inside’ actors/parents/... [They] were protecting government from us." (...)

"Through [their] advice & consent rules, the Intelligence Branch uses the SSCI to keep out people [they] consider dangerous to [their] ongoing (il legal/se cret) operations. Any appointee must first pass through the Senate Sel ect Commi ttee on Intelligence, before they get a full Senate vote. If the SSCI rejects the candidate, they simply refuse to take up the nomination. The president is then blocked from that appointment. This is what happened with President Trump over-and-over again." (...)

"Donald J. #Trump, an outsider who was a risk to every entity in the institutional construct of Washington DC. Trillions were at stake, and years of affluence and influence were at risk as the unholy alliance was put together."

"To understand the risk that #JulianAssange represented to U.S. Intelligence Branch interests, it is important to understand just how extensive the operations of the [FBi/CiA] were in 2016. Its within the network of foreign & domestic intel operations where Intelligence Branch political tool, "FBI Agent" Peter Strzok, was working as a bridge between the CIA & FBI counterintelligence operations." (...)

"The creation of the Saudi Arabia 🇸🇦 intelligence network was specifically because the Obama administration started supporting radical Islamists within the Muslim Brotherhood & threw fuel on the fires of extremism all over the Arab world. Think about it, what would you do if you were 🇸🇦 Saudi Arabia, 🇪🇬 Egypt, 🇧🇭 Bahrain, 🇰🇼 Kuwait, the 🇦🇪 UAE, 🇯🇴 Jordan, Oman or 🇾🇪 Yemen & you knew the United States 🇺🇸 could just trigger an internal uprising of [their] al-Qaeda, ISIS & the political arm of the Muslim Brotherhood to seek your destruction? Without a doubt, those urgent lessons from 2009, 2010, 2011 triggered the formation of the Arab Intelligence Network as a network to defend itself with consistency. They assembled the network & activated it in 2017 as pictured above." (...)

"The Obama network took pre-assembled intelligence weapons we should never have allowed to be created & turned those weapons into tools for his radical & fundamental change. The target was the essential fabric of our nation. Ultimately, this corrupt political process gave power to create the Fourth Branch of Government, the Intelligence Branch. From that perspective the fundamental change was successful.

Every person in [their] DC system, regardless of where they are located in their containment silos, knew what had taken place. [They] all knew. No one in DC did not know. This is the very reason why both parties desperately needed to get Andrew Weissmann & Robert Mueller installed. The 2017 special counsel, under guise of a Trump-Russia investigation, was [their] COVER UP plan. Intent of [their] special counsel was to protect all the inside & outside 'agents' across all branches who has been working together against Trump throughout his candidacy & into Trumps presidency." (...)
